&#160; UNITED STATES SECURITIES AND EXCHANGE COMMISSION Washington, D.C. 20549 &#160; &#160; FORM 8-K &#160; &#160; CURRENT REPORT Pursuant to Section&#160;13 or 15(d) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 Date of Report (date of earliest event reported): November&#160;6, 2023 &#160; NASDAQ 2.625% Notes due 2033 &#160; MSFT &#160; NASDAQ Indicate by check mark whether the registrant is an emerging growth company as defined in Rule 405 of the Securities Act of 1933 (&#167;230.405 of this chapter) or Rule 12b-2 of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 (&#167;240.12b-2 of this chapter). Emerging growth company&#8194; &#9744; If an emerging growth company, indicate by check mark if the registrant has elected not to use the extended transition period for complying with any new or revised financial accounting standards provided pursuant to Section&#160;13(a) of the Exchange Act.&#8194;&#9744; &#160; &#160; &#160; Item&#160;8.01 Other Events. Exchange Offers and Consent Solicitations On November&#160;6, 2023, Microsoft Corporation (&#8220;Microsoft&#8221;) completed the early settlement (the &#8220;Early Settlement&#8221;) of Existing Activision Blizzard Notes (as defined below) as part of its previously-announced private offers to eligible holders to exchange (each, an &#8220;Exchange Offer&#8221; and, collectively, the &#8220;Exchange Offers&#8221;) any and all outstanding notes issued by Activision Blizzard, Inc., a wholly-owned subsidiary of Microsoft (&#8220;Activision Blizzard&#8221;) as set forth in the table below (the &#8220;Existing Activision Blizzard Notes&#8221;) for (1)&#160;new notes issued by&#160;Microsoft and (2)&#160;cash. The Exchange Offers were not registered under the Securities Act of 1933, as amended (the &#8220;Securities Act&#8221;), or any state or foreign securities laws. Concurrently with the Exchange Offers,&#160;Activision Blizzard solicited&#160;consents (each, a &#8220;Consent Solicitation&#8221; and, collectively, the &#8220;Consent Solicitations&#8221;) to adopt certain proposed amendments (the &#8220;Amendments&#8221;) to each of the indentures governing the Existing&#160;Activision Blizzard&#160;Notes (the &#8220;Existing Activision Blizzard Indentures&#8221;) to eliminate certain of the covenants, restrictive&#160;provisions and events of default of such Existing Activision Blizzard Indentures. Pursuant to the Exchange Offers and Consent Solicitations, the aggregate principal amounts of the Existing Activision Blizzard Notes set forth in the table below were validly tendered and subsequently accepted. Such accepted Existing Activision Blizzard Notes were retired and canceled and will not be reissued. Following such cancellation, the aggregate principal amounts of the Existing Activision Blizzard Notes set forth below remains outstanding. &#160; Title of Series of Existing Activision Blizzard Notes &#160;&#160; Aggregate Principal Amount Tendered and Accepted&#160;at&#160;Early&#160;Settlement &#160; &#160;&#160; Aggregate Principal&#160;Amount Outstanding Following&#160;Early&#160;Settlement &#160; 3.400% Senior Notes due 2026 &#160;&#160; $ &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; &#160; &#160;&#160; $ 762,456,000 &#160; &#160;&#160; $ 87,544,000 &#160; 3.400% Senior Notes due 2027 &#160;&#160; $ &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; &#160; &#160;&#160; $ 353,183,000 &#160; &#160;&#160; $ 43,817,000 &#160; 1.350% Senior Notes due 2030 &#160;&#160; $ &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; &#160; &#160;&#160; $ 442,842,000 &#160; &#160;&#160; $ 57,158,000 &#160; 4.500% Senior Notes due 2047 &#160;&#160; $ &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; &#160; &#160;&#160; $ 391,290,000 &#160; &#160;&#160; $ 8,710,000 &#160; 2.500% Senior Notes due 2050 &#160;&#160; $ &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; &#160; &#160;&#160; $ 1,439,312,000 &#160; &#160;&#160; $ 60,688,000 &#160; Prior to the Early Settlement and upon receipt of the requisite consents to adopt the Amendments with respect to the indentures governing each series of Existing Activision Blizzard Notes, the following supplemental indentures (collectively, the &#8220;Supplemental Activision Blizzard Indentures&#8221;) were executed, eliminating certain of the covenants, restrictive provisions and events of default under the Existing Activision Blizzard Indentures: (i) the First Supplemental Indenture, dated October&#160;27, 2023, between Activision Blizzard, as issuer, and Computershare Trust Company, N.A. (&#8220;Computershare&#8221;) (as successor to Wells Fargo Bank, National Association (&#8220;Well Fargo Bank&#8221;)), as trustee, amending that certain Indenture, dated September&#160;19, 2016, between Activision Blizzard and Wells Fargo Bank (the &#8220;2016 Activision Blizzard Indenture&#8221;), pursuant to which Activision Blizzard issued its 3.400% Senior Notes due 2026; (ii) the Third Supplemental Indenture, dated October&#160;27, 2023, between Activision Blizzard, as issuer, and Computershare (as successor to Wells Fargo Bank), as trustee, amending that certain Indenture, dated May&#160;26, 2017, between Activision Blizzard and Wells Fargo Bank (the &#8220;Activision Blizzard Base Indenture&#8221;), as supplemented by that certain First Supplemental Indenture, dated May&#160;26, 2017, between Activision Blizzard and Wells Fargo Bank (the &#8220;2017 Activision Blizzard Supplemental Indenture&#8221;), pursuant to which Activision Blizzard issued its 3.400% Senior Notes due 2027 and 4.500% Senior Notes due 2047; and (iii) the Fourth Supplemental Indenture, dated October&#160;27, 2023, between Activision Blizzard, as issuer and Computershare (as successor to Wells Fargo Bank), amending the Activision Blizzard Base Indenture, as supplemented by that certain Second Supplemental Indenture, dated August&#160;10, 2020, between Activision Blizzard and Wells Fargo Bank (together with the 2016 Activision Blizzard Indenture, the Activision Blizzard Base Indenture and the 2017 Activision Blizzard Supplemental Indenture, the &#8220;Existing Activision Blizzard Indentures&#8221;), pursuant to which Activision Blizzard issued its 1.350% Senior Notes due 2030 and 2.500% Senior Notes due 2050. The Amendments became operative upon the Early Settlement. The foregoing summary of the Supplemental Activision Blizzard Indentures does not purport to be complete and is qualified in its entirety by reference to the full text of (i)&#160;the Existing Activision Blizzard Indentures attached as Exhibits 4.9, 4.10, 4.11 and 4.12 hereto and (ii)&#160;the Supplemental Activision Blizzard Indentures attached as Exhibits 4.13, 4.14 and 4.15 hereto, the terms of which are, in each case, incorporated herein by reference. Microsoft Base Indenture, Supplemental Indenture and New Notes In connection with the Early Settlement, on November&#160;6, 2023, Microsoft issued: &#160; &#160; (i) $762,456,000 aggregate principal amount of 3.400% Notes due 2026 (the &#8220;New Microsoft 2026 Notes&#8221;); &#160; &#160; (ii) $353,183,000 aggregate principal amount of 3.400% Notes due 2027 (the &#8220;New Microsoft 2027 Notes&#8221;); &#160; &#160; (iii) $442,842,000 aggregate principal amount of 1.350% Notes due 2030 (the &#8220;New Microsoft 2030 Notes&#8221;); &#160; &#160; (iv) $391,290,000 aggregate principal amount of 4.500% Notes due 2047 (the &#8220;New Microsoft 2047 Notes&#8221;); &#160; &#160; (v) $1,439,312,000 aggregate principal amount of 2.500% Notes due 2050 (the &#8220;New Microsoft 2050 Notes&#8221; and, together with the New Microsoft 2026 Notes, the New Microsoft 2027 Notes, the New Microsoft 2030 Notes and the New Microsoft 2047 Notes, the &#8220;New Microsoft Notes&#8221;). The New Microsoft Notes are governed by an indenture, dated as of May&#160;18, 2009 (the &#8220;Base Indenture&#8221;), between Microsoft, as issuer, and The Bank of New York Mellon Trust Company, N.A., as trustee (the &#8220;New Microsoft Notes Trustee&#8221;), as supplemented by the Fifteenth Supplemental Indenture, dated as of November&#160;6, 2023 (the &#8220;Fifteenth Supplemental Indenture&#8221;), between Microsoft and the New Microsoft Notes Trustee. The New Microsoft Notes are Microsoft&#8217;s senior unsecured obligations and rank equally with Microsoft&#8217;s other unsecured and unsubordinated debt from time to time outstanding. The interest rate and maturity date for each series of New Microsoft Notes is as follows: &#160; &#160; (i) The 2026 Notes will bear interest at a rate of 3.400% per annum and will mature on September&#160;15, 2026; &#160; &#160; (ii) The 2027 Notes will bear interest at a rate of 3.400% per annum and will mature on June&#160;15, 2027; and &#160; &#160; (iii) The 2030 Notes will bear interest at a rate of 1.350% per annum and will mature on September&#160;15, 2030; &#160; &#160; (iv) The 2047 Notes will bear interest at a rate of 3.400% per annum and will mature on June&#160;15, 2047; and &#160; &#160; (v) The 2050 Notes will bear interest at a rate of 2.500% per annum and will mature on September&#160;15, 2050. The foregoing summaries of the Fifteenth Supplemental Indenture and the New Microsoft Notes do not purport to be complete and each is qualified in its entirety by reference to the applicable full text of (i)&#160;the Base Indenture attached as Exhibit 4.1 hereto; (ii)&#160;the Fifteenth Supplemental Indenture attached as Exhibit 4.2 hereto; and (iii)&#160;the forms of the New Microsoft Notes attached as Exhibits 4.3, 4.4, 4.5, 4.6 and 4.7 hereto, the terms of which are, in each case, incorporated herein by reference. Registration Rights Agreement On November&#160;6, 2023, in connection with the Early Settlement, Microsoft, BofA Securities, Inc., J.P. Morgan Securities LLC, Wells Fargo Securities, LLC, Academy Securities, Inc., CastleOak Securities, L.P., Drexel Hamilton, LLC, Loop Capital Markets LLC, MFR Securities, Inc., Mischler Financial Group, Inc., RBC Capital Markets, LLC, Samuel A Ramirez&#160;&amp; Company, Inc. and Siebert Williams Shank&#160;&amp; Co., LLC, as dealer managers, entered into a registration rights agreement with respect to the New Microsoft Notes (the &#8220;Registration Rights Agreement&#8221;). Microsoft agreed under the Registration Rights Agreement to, among other things, use its commercially reasonable efforts to (i)&#160;file a registration statement on an appropriate registration form with respect to a registered offer to exchange each series of the New Microsoft Notes for new notes, with terms substantially identical in all material respects to such series of the New Microsoft Notes (except that the new notes will not be subject to restrictions on transfer or any increase in annual interest rate), and (ii)&#160;cause such registration statement to become effective under the Securities Act. Microsoft shall pay additional interest on the New Microsoft Notes of up to 1.0% if, among other things, the registered exchange offer is not completed on or prior to January&#160;29, 2025, or a shelf registration statement is required and is not declared effective on or prior to the 60th day after the later of (i)&#160;January&#160;29, 2025 and (ii)&#160;the date on which Microsoft receives a duly executed request by a dealer manager or certain holders for the filing of a shelf registration. The foregoing summary of the Registration Rights Agreement does not purport to be complete and is qualified in its entirety by reference to the full text of the Registration Rights Agreement attached as Exhibit 4.8 hereto, the terms of which are incorporated herein by reference. &#160; Item&#160;9.01 Financial Statements and Exhibits. &#160; (d) Exhibits.
